climbs.name: Water Drawn From an Ancient Well

content.description: Follow a broken crack on juggy holds and finger locks to a single bolt.  After the crack the climbing is slabby and much easier.
content.protection: Small stoppers and finger size cams.
content.location: Look for the broken crack on the south side of the rock.

content.description: Good ol’ fashioned Mcdowell slab climbing.  But maybe a little better protected.  Start on an easy ramp and make a few moves up to a steeper wall.  Crimps, crystals and micro edges will get you through the first bolt.  Follow slightly easier terrain trending right along the obvious contours of the route.
content.location: Located on the south face to the left of a pointy tipped boulder.

content.description: Climb up through a bulge and make thin face moves, past 2 bolts, to the anchors.
content.protection: Small gear to protect below the bulge.  2 bolts.

content.description: Wag your tail is a smallish crag located at the base of Tom’s Thumb just southwest from the start of Trieber's deception.  It’s a sunny crag, easy to top rope and has three interesting climbs.
